metadata.Title: CVE-2021-1826 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.3, iOS 14.5 and iPadOS 14.5, watchOS 7.4, tvOS 14.5. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.30.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.30.3-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.30.3-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.3-1').
